text: We love The Old Phoenix - this is the fourth time we‚Äôve visited in the last ten years or so. It‚Äôs secluded and quiet, and the swimming in the bay is sublime. If you‚Äôre expecting five-star luxury, go somewhere else; this is a traditional family-run place, with a warm welcome, uncomplicated but delicious Cretan food and simple but comfortable, clean accommodation with wonderful views out over the Libyan Sea.
student a:
The Old Phoenix is a traditional family-run place, with a warm welcome.
Cretan food and simple but comfortable, clean accommodation.
We love The Old Phoenix - this is the fourth time we've visited in the last ten years.
student b: this is the fourth time we‚Äôve visited the old Phoenix in the last ten years or so. it‚Äôs secluded and quiet, and the swimming in the bay is sublime. this is a traditional family-run place with a warm welcome, uncomplicated but delicious Cretan food and simple but comfortable, clean accommodation with wonderful views out over the Libyan Sea.

text:
What a disappointment. We have wanted to stay here for years but it was not a nice experience. Fine for a day at the beach and lunch at the taverna but don‚Äôt expect friendly service, the waiters couldn‚Äôt care less. And do not stay here! Rooms are tired,  beds uncomfortable, bathrooms stink and they only empty the bins and clean every 3 days which really doesn‚Äôt help the smell in the bathroom! No-one friendly or nice except the poor overworked cleaning lady.
Go a bit further on and stay with Pablos at Akrogialis - so welcoming and gorgeous rooms. Boat or walk to Marmara beach for a nice day and lovely lunch at the taverna there also.

text: We walked over to Fenix from Loutro and stayed the day on the beach by the Old Phoenix. Wonderful small stony beach, clean clear water and very quiet. Had lunch in the restaurant that was very good, fresh local ingredients and lovely service. Highly recommend other to come and see for themselves. If we come to Crete again we will come here and stay in one of their rooms.
student a:
We walked over to Fenix from Loutro and stayed the day on the beach by the Old Phoenix.
Had lunch in the restaurant that was very good, fresh local ingredients and lovely service. Highly recommend other to come and see for themselves.
student b: we walked over to stony beach from Loutro and stayed the day on the beach by the old Phoenix. if we come to Crete again we will come here and stay in one of their rooms.

text: The Old Phoenix was the low point of our two week vacation. Our room looked nothing like the photos. No art on the walls, fluorescent blue lights (and fluorescent reading lights, well, only one worked, that were brighter than the overheads), rough sheets, drain smell in unventilated bathroom, restaurant service dismissive. We slept terribly and would choose not coming to the area over staying here again. We stayed at many similarly priced/classed spots geared to hikers and of course none of them were fancy but this is the only one we have complaints about. Baffled by good reviews elsewhere on this site and in newspapers ‚Äî¬†maybe something has changed.
student a:
The Old Phoenix was the low point of our two week vacation.
We slept terribly and would choose not coming to the area over staying here again.
Baffled by good reviews elsewhere on this site and in newspapers ‚Äî maybe something has changed.
student b: the old Phoenix was the low point of our two week vacation. we stayed at many similarly priced/classed spots geared to hikers.

text:
I had a fantastic time at Old-Phoenix!
The beautiful beach on site provided the perfect backdrop for a relaxing vacation.

The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, making my stay even more enjoyable.
The traditional regional Greek cuisine at the restaurant was delicious, allowing me to truly savor the flavors of Greece. The rooms were spotlessly clean and well-maintained, contributing to a comfortable and rejuvenating stay.
I highly recommend Old-Phoenix and look forward to returning soon!
student a:
I had a fantastic time at Old-Phoenix!
The beautiful beach on site provided the perfect backdrop for a relaxing vacation.
The traditional regional Greek cuisine at the restaurant was delicious.
student b: the staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, making my stay even more enjoyable. the traditional regional Greek cuisine at the restaurant was delicious. the rooms were spotlessly clean and well-maintained, contributing to a comfortable and rejuvenating stay. I highly recommend Old-Phoenix and look forward to returning soon!

text: On the way from Marmara to Loutro I stopped for breakfast. I had a coffee and a yogurt, finally after 30 minutes the yogurt didn't arrive, so I went to the boss to pay for my coffee and everything was fine.  Then the waiter came and although I did not ask for anything, he tried to justify the long wait and then said, "If you were in a hurry, you should not have stopped‚Äù. What a blow. I was not in a hurry and find it utterly disrespectful to wish I had not come to this place...very different from the natural hospitality I experienced in Crete. I hope to come back in the future and have a better experience.
student a:
Loutro is a small town in central Crete.
The town is known for its natural hospitality.
It is also a popular tourist destination.

text:
If you are looking for a get away from it all travelling experience then look no further. The location and view is absolutely stunning. We originally came here because it‚Äôs a great base for walking but increasingly we like chilling out and relaxing on the beach.

We like to walk the Aradena Gorge or go into Loutro , Marmara and beyond sampling the various tavernas along the way but most of all we love just ‚Äúbeing‚Äùat The Pheonix.

It‚Äôs a simple, quiet taverna but to us as soon as we arrive to the warm and friendly welcome it‚Äôs like coming home.
student a:
We originally came here because it‚Äôs a great base for walking but increasingly we like chilling out and relaxing on the beach.
We like to walk the Aradena Gorge or go into Loutro, Marmara and beyond sampling the various tavernas along the way.

text:
I really don't understand how so many people liked the food and the service. In our case we had a waiter constantly coming to our chair to demand 5 euro for the beach seat.

The same waiter later rushed us into chosing something to eat and forgot to note the appetizer that we ordered.
The food was very disappointing. The quality was a typical tourist trap. If you had experiences with great affordable food in Crete you know when the restaurant doesn't care much about quality.

The workers in this place looked like they hated being there and were more worried to inspect who took which chair at the beach and who hasn't paid them yet instead of taking care of the restaurant. In the end the chairs are easy untaxed money whereas the food... Well, you gotta do some work to prepare.

text:
I stayed here with some friends for 6 weeks in 1981. It is a fantastic place to stay for as long as you want. I have been back quite a few times since, the family that run it are very friendly, more like family to me. It is nice to meet the walkers who come by and people off the boats so a good time can be had. If you like walking you can discover a lot in the south western Crete, up in the mountains and the Samaria gorge.
The food is very good, fresh daily, ask for the bean soup,it's the best.
student a:
If you like walking you can discover a lot in the south western Crete.
The food is very good, fresh daily, ask for the bean soup,it's the best.

text: You'll pass this place on your hike along this stunning coast. The taverna looks inviting and as modern as Tesla, well at least in these parts. I sat at 1205pm and was told the kitchen doesn't open for 25 minutes...have some stuffed tomatoes and tzatziki. Sounded like a capital idea. When the arrived, they were quite satisfying. Not the greatest tzatziki in the area (a bit thin on garlic, and ok yoghurt), and the tomatoes were actually very good. The guy serving was lovely an owner. He was as happy to see me as he would be his ex wife on her usual alimony collection day. When I tried to pay by card, I was told that was impossible. When I had no cash, it was unlikely...when i was passed to his friendly senior colleague, it was no trouble at all...yeah, nah...that'll cost you a point brother. Say hi to your ex for me üòâ
student a:

The guy serving was lovely an owner. He was as happy to see me as he would be his ex wife.

text:
The strong point of this hotel is its unique location and wonderful views.    The owners are friendly but my bathroom smelled of drains and there was poor grouting with dark brown stains.     The bedrooms were only serviced once every three days and the manager was very surprised when I questioned this.
As one cannot put lavatory paper down the loo but you have to use a bin, this was pretty unhygienic.
The food was fine and freshly cooked.
